lines.gurmukhi: 1 is`KI AOKI pr Amolk hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankaar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: vwlhu inkI AwKIAY KMfy Dwrhu suxIAY iqKI
lines.transliteration_english: Vaalahu Nikee Aakheeai Khanday Dhaarahu Souneeai Tikhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikh spirit is subtler than a trichome and sharper than the edge of sword.

lines.gurmukhi: AwKix AwiK n skIAY lyK AlyK n jweI ilKI
lines.transliteration_english: Aakhani Aakhi N Sakeeai Laykh Alaykh N Jaaee Likhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nothing can be said or explained about it and its indescribable account cannot be written.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pMQu vKwxIAY ApiV n skY iekqu ivKI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Pandu Vakhaaneeai Aparhi N Sakai Ikatu Vikhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Defined as the way of the Gurmukhs, it cannot be attained by a single step.

lines.gurmukhi: isl AwlUxI ctxI quil n lK AimA rs ieKI
lines.transliteration_english: Sil Aaloonee Chatanee Tuli N Lakh Amia Ras Ikhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is like licking a tasteless stone but the joy of even the juice of millions of sweet sugar cane, cannot be compared with it.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu pwieAw Bwie Bgiq ivrlI ju ibrKI
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Paaiaa Bhaai Bhagati Viralee Ju Birakhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs have attained the pleasure-fruit of loving devotion which grows on rare trees.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur quTY pweIAY swDsMgiq gurmiq gurisKI
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Toutdai Paaeeai Saadhasangati Guramati Gurasikhee.

Shabad OS B.translation: By the grace of the true Guru, following the wisdom of the Guru and in the holy congregation alone the Sikh spirit is attained.

lines.gurmukhi: cwir pdwrQ iBKk iBKI ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Padaarad Bhikhak Bhikhee ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: Four ideals (dharma, arth, katm and rooks) of life are begged by the beggars.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 isKI inSkwm hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikh life is without desires

lines.gurmukhi: cwir pdwrQ AwKIAin siqgur dyie n gurisKu mMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Padaarad Aakheeani Satigur Dayi N Gurasikhu Mangai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru himself bestows the four ideals; the Sikh of the Guru does a ask for them.

lines.gurmukhi: AT isDI inDI nvY iriD n guru isKu FwkY tMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Atd Sidhi Nidhee Navai Ridhi N Guru Sikhu Ddhaakai Tangai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh never carries on his back the nine treasures and eight miraculous powers.

lines.gurmukhi: kwmDyxu lK lKmI phuMc n hMGY FMig suFMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaamadhaynu Lakh Lakhamee Pahounch N Hanghai Ddhangi Suddhangai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wish fulfilling cow and millions of Laksamis, 'With their fine gestures cannot reach a gursikh â€” Sikh of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: lK pwrs lK pwrjwq hiQ n Cuhdw Pl n ABMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Paaras Lakh Paarijaat Hadi N Chhuhadaa Phal N Abhangai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh of the Guru never touches the philosopher's stone or transitory fruits millions of wishfulfilling trees.

lines.gurmukhi: qMq mMq pwKMf lK bwjIgr bwjwrI nMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Tant Mant Paakhand Lakh Baajeegar Baajaaree Nagai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of tantrists knowing mantras and tantras are mere naked acrobats for a Sikh of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: pIr murIdI gwKVI ieks AMig n AMgix AMgY
lines.transliteration_english: Peer Mureedee Gaakharhee Ikas Angi N Angani Angai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The GuruÂ­ disciple relationship is very complex because many are its laws and byelaws.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKu dUjy Bwvhu sMgY ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikhu Doojay Bhaavahu Sangai ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh of the Guru is ever shy of the sense of duality.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 isKI dI Amolkqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Invaluableness of Sikh life

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKI dw isKxw nwdu n vyd n AwiK vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Sikhanaa Naadu N Vayd N Aakhi Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The discipline of the discipleship of the Guru is ineffable for the Vedas and all the melodies.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKI dw ilKxw lK n icqR gupiq iliK jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Likhanaa Lakh N Chitr Goupati Likhi Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even Chitragupt, the writer of the accounts of the actions of the people, does not know how to write about the spirit of Sikh life.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw ismrxo syK AsMK n ryK is\\\\wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Simaranon Saykh Asankh N Raykh Siaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The glory of simaran, remembrance of the name of the Lord, cannot be known by myriad Seanags (thousand hooded mythical snake).

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKI dw vrqmwnu vIh iekIh aulMiG pCwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Varatamaanu Veeh Ikeeh Ulaghi Pachhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The conduct of the Sikh spirit can be known only by going beyond the worldly phenomena.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw buJxw igAwn iDAwn AMdir ikv AwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Bujhanaa Giaan Dhiaan Andari Kiv Aanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: How can anybody understand the Sikh way of life or Gursikhi through learning and contemplation alone?

lines.gurmukhi: gur prswdI swD sMig sbd suriq hoie mwxu inmwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Parasaadi Saadhasangi Sabad Surati Hoi Maanu Nimaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: By the grace of the Guru, in the holy congregation, the gursikh concentrating his consciousness in the Word sheds pride and becomes humble.

lines.gurmukhi: Bwie Bgiq ivrlw rMgu mwxY ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhaai Bhagati Viralaa Rangu Maanai ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: A rare one may enjoy the pleasure of loving devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 is`KI dI is`KRXw qy rs

Shabad OS B.translation: Joy and teachings of the Sikh life

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKI dw isKxw gurmuiK swDsMgiq dI syvw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Sikhanaa Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Dee Sayvaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The way of learning the conduct of a Sikh of the Guru is that one should be the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: ds Avqwr n isiKAw gIqw gosit AlK AByvw
lines.transliteration_english: Das Avataar N Sikhiaa Geetaa Gosati Alakh Abhayvaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: This mystery was not known even to the ten incarnations (of Visrnu); this mystery is beyond the Gita and discussions.

lines.gurmukhi: vyd n jwxn Byd ikhu iliK piV suix sxu dyvI dyvw
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd N Jaanan Bhayd Kihu Likhi Parhi Souni Sanu Dayvee Dayvaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then the Vedas know not its secret though they are studied by gods and godesses.

lines.gurmukhi: isD nwQ n smwiD ivic qMq n mMq lMGwiein Kyvw
lines.transliteration_english: Sidh Naad N Samaadhi Vichi Tant N Mant Laghaaini Khayvaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The deep meditations of the siddhs, naths and even the tanttaÂ­tras could not cross the teachings and practices of Sikh way of life.

lines.gurmukhi: lK Bgiq jgq ivic iliK n gey guru isKI tyvw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Bhagati Jagat Vichi Likhi N Gaay Guru Sikhee Tayvaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of devotees flourished in this World but they also could not understand the life-discipline of the Sikhs of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: islw AlUxI ctxI swid n pujY lK lK myvw
lines.transliteration_english: Silaa Aloonee Chatanee Saadi N Pujai Lakh Lakh Mayvaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: This life is similar the licking of the saltless stone but its taste is incomparable even to the millions of fruits.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbd smyvw ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gur Sabad Samayvaa ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Absorption in the word of the Guru in the holy congregation is the accomplishment of the life of a gursikh.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 is`KI dI pRwpqI dw pRkwr

Shabad OS B.translation: Practices for attainment of Sikh-life

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw isKxw sbid suriq siqsMgiq isKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Sikhanaa Sabadi Surati Satisangati Sikhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: To learn about Sikh-life, one ought to merge one's consciousness in the Word in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw ilKxw gur bwxI suix smJY ilKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Likhanaa Gurabaanee Souni Samajhai Likhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Writing about Sikh life is to go on listening, understanding and continuously writing.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw ismrxo siqguru mMqu kolU rsu ieKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Simarano Satiguru Mantu Koloo Rasu Ikhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Simran, meditation in Sikh life is learning the Guru-mantra (Vahiguru) which is sweet like sugarcane juice.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw vrqmwnu cMdn vwsu invwsu ibirKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Varatamaanu Chandan Vaasu Nivaasu Birikhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The spirit of the Sikhism is like fragrance residing in sandalwood trees.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw buJxw buiJ AbuiJ hovY lY iBKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Bujhanaa Bujhi Abujhi Hovai Lai Bhikhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The understanding of a Sikh of the Guru consists in the fact that even after having received the gifted alms (of nom) and being fully knowledgeable, he considered himself as ignorant.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu suix nwmu dwnu iesnwnu sirKY
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Souni Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Sarikhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh of the Guru, in the holy congregation listens to the word of the Guru and practises meditation, charity and ablution,

lines.gurmukhi: vrqmwnu lMiG BUq BivKY ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Varatamaanu Laghi Bhoot Bhavikhai ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: And thus goes across the past present to a new the future.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 is`KI pRwpqI dw pRkwr

Shabad OS B.translation: Conduct of the Sikh life

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKI dw bolxw huie imT bolw ilKY n lyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Bolanaa Hui Mitd Bolaa Likhai N Laykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh life one speaks mildly and never gets oneself noticed i.e. ego is diated.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw clxw clY BY ivic lIqy ByKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Chalanaa Chalai Bhai Vichi Leetay Bhaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Maintaining the Sikh form and moving in the fear of the Lord constitute the Sikh way of living.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw rwhu eyhu gurmuiK cwl clY so dyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Raahu Ayhu Guramoukhi Chaal Chalai So Daykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikh living means following the footsteps gursikhs.

lines.gurmukhi: Gwil Kwie syvw krY gur aupdysu Avysu ivsyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghaali Khaai Sayvaa Karai Gur Oupadaysu Avaysu Visaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: One should eat the fruit of one's own labour, do service and could always remain inspired by the teachings of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gxwie n ApVY Awpu gvwey rUp n ryKY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Ganaai N Aparhai Aapu Gavaaay Roop N Raykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The supreme rd is not attained through egotism and only after losing the sense of ego e can identify oneself with the formless and limitless Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: murdy vwNgu murId hoie gur gorI viV AlK AlyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Muraday Vaang Mureed Hoi Gur Goree Varhi Alakh Alaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A disciple coming like a dead person and entering into the guru-grave can merge in at imperceptible Lord who is beyond all writs.

lines.gurmukhi: AMqu n mMqu n syK sryKY ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Antu N Mantu N Saykh Saraykhai ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Sesanags could not derstand the mystery of His mantra.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 is`KI dI Amolkqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Invalnability of Sikh life

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKI dw isKxw guru isK isKx bjru Bwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Sikhanaa Guru Sikh Sikhan Bajaru Bhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Learning of the Sikh way of life is as tough as the thunderbolt and only the Sikhs of the Guru learn it.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isKI dw ilKxw lyKu AlyKu n ilKxhwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Likhanaa Laykhu Alaykhu N Likhanahaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Writing about the Sikh-life is also beyond all accounts; none can write.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isKI dw qolxw quil n qoil qulY qul Dwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Tolanaa Tuli N Toli Tulai Tuladhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: No scale can weigh the Sikh way of life.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isKI dw dyKxw gurmuiK swDsMgiq gurduAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Daykhanaa Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Guraduaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The glimpse of the Sikh life can be had only in the holy congregation and the Gurdvara, the door of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isKI dw cKxw swDsMgiq guru sbdu vIcwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Chakhanaa Saadhasangati Guru Sabadu Veechaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Pondering upon the word of Guru in the holy congregation is like tasting of the Sikh way of life.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isKI dw smJxw joqI joiq jgwvxhwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Samajhanaa Jotee Joti Jagaavanahaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Understanding of the Sikh life is like kindling the flame of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprmu ipAwrw ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piramu Piaaraa ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: The pleasure-fruit of the Gurmukhs is the love of the dear Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 is`DI pwky au`cy hoeIdw hY

Shabad OS B.translation: One becomes truthful after attaining the Sikh-life

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw rUp dyiK ieks bwJu n horsu dyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Roop Daykhi Ikas Baajhu N Horasu Daykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: One who has attained Sikh-life does not wish to have glimpse of any (god, goddess) except the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw cKxw lK AMmiRq Pl iPkY lyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Chakhanaa Lakh Anmrit Phal Dhikai Laykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: To one who has tasted the Sikh-life, million of ambrosial fruits taste mawkish.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw nwdu suix lK Anhd ivsmwd AlyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Naadu Souni Lakh Anahad Visamaad Alaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Listening to the melody of Sikh-life, one enjoys the wondrous delight of millions of unstruck melodies.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKI dw prsxw TMFw qqw ByK AByKY
lines.transliteration_english: Guroo Sikhee Daa Parasanaa Tdaddhaa Tataa Bhaykh Abhaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who have come in touch with the Sikh spirit have gone beyond the impacts of :hot and cold, guise and disguise.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dI vwsu lY huie durgMD sugMD sryKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Vaasu Lai Hui Duragandh Sougandh Saraykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having inhaled the fragrance of Sikh life, one feels all other fragrances as a smell.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI mr jIvxw Bwie Bgiq BY inmK inmyKY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Mar Jeevanaa Bhaai Bhagati Bhai Nimakh Namaykhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: One who has started living the ,Sikh way of life, lives every moment in loving devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: Alyp rhY gur sbid ivsyKY ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Alapi Rahai Gur Sabadi Visaykhai ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: Subsumed in the 'word of Guru, he remains detached from the world.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 is`KI dw krq`b

Shabad OS B.translation: Activity in the Sikh-life

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK scw pMQu hY isKu shj Gir jwie KlovY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sachaa Pandu Hai Sikhu Sahaj Ghari Jaai Khalovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The way of gurmukhs is that way of truth treading which, the Sikh automatically stabilizes in his innate nature.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK scu rhrwis hY pYrIN pY pwKwku ju hovY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Sachu Raharaasi Hai Paireen Pai Paa Khaaku Ju Hovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The conduct of gurmukhs is true; touching of the feet and becoming of dust of the feet i.e. getting most humble is their active behaviour.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isKI dw nwvxw gurmiq lY durmiq mlu DovY
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Sikhee Daa Naavanaa Guramati Lai Duramati Malu Dhovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The ablution in Sikh-life is washing away of evil propensities by adopting the wisdom of the Guru (gurmat).

lines.gurmukhi: guru isKI dw pUjxw gurisK pUj iprm rsu BovY
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Sikhee Daa Poojanaa Gurasikh Pooj Piram Rasu Bhovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Worship in Sikh-life is the worship (service) to the Sikhs of the Guru and getting drenched in the shower of love of the dear Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isKI dw mMnxw gur bcnI gil hwru provY
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Sikhee Daa Mannanaa Gur Bachanee Gali Haaru Parovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wearing the words of the Guru like garland, is the accepting of the will of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isKI dw jIvxw jIvidAwN mir haumY KovY
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Sikhee Daa Jeevanaa Jeenvadiaan Mari Haoumai Khovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Life of a gursikh is being dead i.e. losing one's ego while alive.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq guru sbd ivlovY ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gur Sabad Vilovai ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: In such a life the word of the Guru is churned in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 is`KI dI kwr

Shabad OS B.translation: Performance of Sikh life

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu Kwvxw duKu suKu sm kir Aaucr crxw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Khaavanaa Doukhu Soukhu Samakari Aouchar Charanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Adopting pleasure and pain equally, the gurmukhs eat the fruit of delight.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw gwvxw AMmiRq bwxI inJru Jrxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Gaavanaa Anmrit Baanee Nijharu Jharanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Music in the Sikh way of life is the continuous flow (singing) of ambrosial hymns of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI DIrju Drmu iprm ipAwlw Ajru jrxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Dheeraju Dharamu Piram Piaalaa Ajaru Jaranaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fortitude and duty in Sikh life is the bearing of the unbearable power of the cup of love.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw sMjmo fir infru infir muc frxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Sanjamo Dari Nidaru Nidar Mouch Daranaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The practice of continence in Sikhism is getting fearless in this scaring world and moving always in the fear of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI imil swDsMig sbd suriq jgu duqru qrxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Mili Saadhasangi Sabad Surati Jagu Doutaru Taranaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Another doctrine of the Sikh life is that joining the holy congregation and concentrating the mind in the word, man goes across the world ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dw krmu eyhu gur Purmwey gurisK krxw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Daa Karamu Ayhu Gur Phuramaaay Gurasikh Karanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Acting according the instructions of the Guru is the performance of the Sikh life.

lines.gurmukhi: gur ikrpw guru isK guru srxw ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Kirapaa Guru Sikhu Guru Saranaa ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: By the grace of the Guru, the disciple (Sikh) remains in the shelter of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 gurU dI SkqI qy gux

Shabad OS B.translation: Powers and virtues of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: vwis suvwsu invwsu kir isMmil gurmuiK suK Pl lwey
lines.transliteration_english: Vaasi Suvaasu Nivaasu Kari Sinmali Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Laaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Diffusing in all the places like fragrance, the gurmukh makes even the mind oriented, manmukh, fragrant by giving him pleasure-fruit.

lines.gurmukhi: soienw hoie mnUru imlu kwghu prm hMsu krvwey
lines.transliteration_english: Paaras Hoi Manooru Malu Kaagahu Param Hansu Karavaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He transforms iron slag into gold and the crows into the swans of highest order (param hails).

lines.gurmukhi: psU pryqhu dyv kir siqgur dyv syv BY pwey
lines.transliteration_english: Pasoo Paraytahu Dayv Kari Satigur Dayv Sayv Bhai Paaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Consequent to the service of the true Guru, animals and ghosts also become gods.

lines.gurmukhi: sB inDwn riK sMK ivic hir jI lY lY hiQ vjwey
lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Nidhaan Rakhi Sankh Vichi Hari Jee Lai Lai Hadi Vajaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having all the treasures in His hand (conch) He goes on distributing them with his hand among the people day and night.

lines.gurmukhi: piqq auDwrxu AwKIAY Bgiq vCl hoie Awpu Clwey
lines.transliteration_english: Patit Udhaaranu Aakheeai Bhagati Vachhal Hoi Aapu Chhalaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Called as the redeemer of the sinners, the Lord, loving to the devotees, gets Himself deluded by the devotees.

lines.gurmukhi: gux kIqy gux kry jgu Avgux kIqy gux gur Bwey
lines.transliteration_english: Goun Keetay Goun Karay Jag Avagoun Keetay Goun Gur Bhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The whole world is good towards the wellwisher alone, but, the Guru loves to do good even to the evil doer.

lines.gurmukhi: praupkwrI jg ivic Awey ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Paraoupakaaree Jag Vichi Aaay ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru has come to the world as a benevolent entity.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 is`K pRRaupkwrI

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikh, the altruist

lines.gurmukhi: Pl dy vt vgwieAw qCxhwrY qwir qrMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Phal Day Vat Vagaaiaan Tachhanahaaray Taari Tarandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: A tree gives fruits to stone thrower and wooden boat to the cutter to get him across.

lines.gurmukhi: qCy puq n fobeI puq vYru jl jI n DrMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Tachhay Pout N Dobaee Pout Vairu Jal Jee N Dharandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Water, the father (of tree) not remembering the evil deeds (of carpenter) does not drown the boat along with carpenter.

lines.gurmukhi: vrsY hoie shMs Dwr imil igl jlu nIvwix clMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Varasai Hoi Sahans Dhaar Mili Gil Jalu Neevaani Chaladaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming thousands of currents when it rains, water in thousand streams flows towards the lower places.

lines.gurmukhi: fobY fbY Agr no Awpu Cif puq pYj rKMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Dobai Dabai Agar No Aapu Chhadi Pout Paij Rakhandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Wood of agar tree is drowned but repudiating ego, water saves the honour of its son, wood of the tree [in fact agar(eaglewood) floats under water surface].

lines.gurmukhi: qir fubY fubw qrY ijix hwrY hwrY su ijxMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Tari Doubai Doubaa Tarai Jini Haarai Haarai Su Jinandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He who goes on swimming upon the water (of love) may be understood as drowned and he who drowns in love, may be considered as having swum across.

lines.gurmukhi: aultw Kylu iprMm dw pYrwN aupir sIsu invMdw
lines.transliteration_english: Ulataa Khaylu Piranm Daa Pairaan Oupari Seesu Nivandaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, winner in the world loses and becoming detached and the loser, one wins (ultimately).

lines.gurmukhi: Awphu iksY n jwxY mMdw ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapahu Kisai N Jaanai Mandaa ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Inverse is the tradition of love which makes the head bow to the feet. The altruist Sikh considers none as the bad or the worse.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 is`K inMmR qy praupkwrI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikh, the humble and the benevolent

lines.gurmukhi: 13 gurisK pRqwpIAwN icrjIvIAwN qoN au`cw suK Pl ivc hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikh, the humble and the benevolent

lines.gurmukhi: DrqI pYrw hyiT hY DrqI hyiT vsMdw pwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Dharatee Pairaan Haytdi Hai Dharatee Haytdi Vasandaa Paanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The earth is under our feet but under the earth is water.

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI clY nIvwx no inrmlu sIqlu suDu prwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Chalai Neevaanu No Niramalu Seetalu Sudhu Paraanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Water flows downward and makes others cool and clean.

lines.gurmukhi: bhu rMgI iek rMgu hY sBnw AMdir ieko jwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Bahu Rangee Ik Rangu Hai Sabhanaan Andari Iko Jaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mixed with various colours it assumes those colours but in itself it is colourless common to all.

lines.gurmukhi: qqw hovY Dup ivic CwvY TMFw ivrqI hwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Tataa Hovai Dhoup Vichi Chhaavai Tdaddhaa Viratee Haanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: It becomes hot in the sun and cool in the shade, that is it acts in consonance with its companions (sun and shade).

lines.gurmukhi: qpdw praupkwr no TMFy praupkwr ivhwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Tapadaa Paraoupakaar No Tdaddhay Paraoupakaar Vihaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Whethger hot or cold its purpose always is other's good.

lines.gurmukhi: Agin buJwey qpiq ivic TMFw hovY iblmu n AwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Agani Bujhaaay Tapati Vichi Tdaddhaa Hovai Bilamu N Aanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though itself warm it extinguishes the fire and takes no time to get cold again.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isKI dI eyh nIswxI ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Sikhee Dee Ayhu Neesaanee ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: These are the virtuous marks of the Sikh culture.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 isK inMmRI qy propkwrI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikh, the humble and the benevolent

lines.gurmukhi: pwxI AMdir Driq hY DrqI AMdir pwxI vsY
lines.transliteration_english: Paanee Andari Dharati Hai Dharatee Andari Paanee Vasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Earth is in water and in the earth also is water.

lines.gurmukhi: DrqI rMgu n rMg sB DrqI swau n sB rs rsY
lines.transliteration_english: Dharatee Rangu N Rang Sabh Dharatee Saau N Sabh Ras Rasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Earth has no colour yet it has all colours (in the form of different vegetation) in it.

lines.gurmukhi: DrqI gMDu n gMD bhu Driq n rUp AnUp qrsY
lines.transliteration_english: Dharatee Gandhu N Gandh Bahu Dharati N Roop Anoop Tarasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Earth has no taste yet all the tastes are contained in it.

lines.gurmukhi: jyhw bIjY so luxY krim BUim sB koeI dsY
lines.transliteration_english: Jayhaa Beejai So Lounai Karami Bhoomi Sabh Koee Dasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: No smell is there in the earth, yet all the fragrances reside in it.

lines.gurmukhi: cMdn lypu n lypu hY kir ml mUq ksUqu n DsY
lines.transliteration_english: Chandan Laypu N Laypu Hai Kari Mal Moot Kasootu N Dhasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Earth is a field for actions; here one reaps what one sows.

lines.gurmukhi: vuTy mIh jmwiedy fiv lgY AMgUru ivgsY
lines.transliteration_english: Voutday Meeh Jamaaiday Davi Lagai Angooru Vigasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Plastered with sandal paste, it does not get attached to it and fouled up by creatures' excreta it does not sink with anger and shame.

lines.gurmukhi: duiK n rovY suiK n hsY ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Doukhi N Rovai Soukhi N Hasai ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: After rains people sow corn in it and even after (getting heat) fire new seedlings sprout from it. It does not wail in suffering nor laughs in pleasure.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 is`K dI in`q kmweI

Shabad OS B.translation: Daily conduct of the Sikh

lines.gurmukhi: ipCl rwqI jwgxw nwmu dwnu iesnwnu idVwey
lines.transliteration_english: Pichhal Raateen Jaaganaa Naamu Daanu Isanaanu Dirhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikh awakes in the pre-dawn hour and meditating upon Nan, he becomes alert for ablution and charity.

lines.gurmukhi: imTw bolxu inv clxu hQhu dy kY Blw mnwey
lines.transliteration_english: Mitdaa Bolanu Niv Chalanu Hadahu Day Kai Bhalaa Manaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He speaks sweetly, moves humbly and giving away something by his hands for the well being of others feels happy.

lines.gurmukhi: QoVw svxw Kwvxw QoVw bolnu gurmiq pwey
lines.transliteration_english: Dorhaa Savanaa Khaavanaa Dorhaa Bolanu Guramati Paaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sleeping and eating maderately he, according to the teachings of the Guru, also does not speak much.

lines.gurmukhi: Gwil Kwie sukiRqu krY vfw hoie n Awpu gxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Ghaali Khaai Soukritu Karai Vadaa Hoi N Aapu Ganaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He toils to earn, performs good deeds and though being great never gets his greatness noticed.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq imil gwNvdy rwiq idhYN inq cil cil jwey
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Mili Gaanvaday Raati Dihain Nit Chali Chali Jaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Walking for day and night he reaches where Gurbant is sung in the congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq prcw krY siqguru prcY mn prcwey
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Parachaa Karai Satiguru Parachai Manu Parachaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: He keeps his consciousness merged in the Word and maintains in the mind love for the true Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: Awsw ivic inrwsu vlwey ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Aasaa Vichi Niraasu Valaaay ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Amid hopes and desires, he remains detached.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 isK dI in`q kmweI

Shabad OS B.translation: Daily conduct of the Sikh

lines.gurmukhi: gur cylw cylw gurU guru isK suix gurisKu sdwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Chaylaa Chaylaa Guroo Guru Sikh Souni Gurasikhu Sadaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Having listened to the teachings of the Guru the disciple and the Guru become one (in form and spirit).

lines.gurmukhi: iek min ieku ArwDxw bwhir jwNdw vrij rhwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Mani Iku Araadhanaa Baahari Jaandaa Varaji Rahaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He with single mind adores the one Lord and keeps his straying mind under control.

lines.gurmukhi: hukmI bMdw hoie kY KsmY dw Bwxw iqsu BwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Houkamee Bandaa Hoi Kai Khasamai Daa Bhaanaa Tisu Bhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He becomes obedient servant of the lord and loves His will and command.

lines.gurmukhi: murdw hoie murId soie ko ivrlw guir goir smwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Muradaa Hoi Mureed Soi Ko Viralaa Guri Gori Samaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Any rare Sikh becoming disciple be a dead person enters the guru-grave.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwku hoie pYrwN aupir sIsu DrwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paakhaaku Hoi Pairaan Oupari Seesu Dharaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Falling on the feet and becoming dust of the feet, he reposes his head on the feet of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gvwey Awpu hoie dUjw Bwau n ndrI AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Gavaaay Aapu Hoi Doojaa Bhaau N Nadaree Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming one with Him he loses his ego and now the sense of duality is nowhere visible with him.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isKI guruisK kmwvY ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Guru Sikhee Guru Sikhu Kamaavai ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Such an accomplishment is had only by Sikh of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 ivrly is`K

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare Sikh

lines.gurmukhi: qy ivrly sYNswr ivic drsn joiq pqMg imlMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Tay Viralay Sainsaar Vichi Darasan Joti Patang Miladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare are those people who like a moth rush toward the flame of the glimpse (of the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: qy ivrly sYNswr ivic sbd suriq hoie imrg mrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Tay Viralay Sainsaar Vichi Sabad Surati Hoi Mirag Maranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: They are also rare in the world who merging their consciousness in the Word die like a deer.

lines.gurmukhi: qy ivrly sYNswr ivic crx kvl huie Bvr vsMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Tay Viralay Sainsaar Vichi Charan Kaval Hui Bhavar Vasanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare are they in this world who like black bee adore lotus feet of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: qy ivrly sYNswr ivic iprm snyhI mIn qrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Tay Viralay Sainsaar Vichi Piram Sanayhee Meen Taranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare are (the Sikhs) in the world who becoming full of love swim like fish.

lines.gurmukhi: qy ivrly sYNswr ivic guru isK guru isK syv krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Tay Viralay Sainsaar Vichi Guru Sikh Guru Sikh Sayv Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Such Sikhs of the Guru are also rare who serve other Sikhs of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: BY ivic jMmin BY rhin BY ivic mir guru isK jIvMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Bhai Vichi Janmani Bhai Rahani Bhai Vichi Mari Guru Sikh Jeevanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Taking birth and sustaining in His order (fear), the Sikhs of the Guru who die while alive (are also rare).

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuK suK Plu iprmu cKMdy ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukh Soukh Phalu Piramu Chakhanday ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus becoming gurmukhs they taste the fruit of joy.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 is`KI srb iSromxI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikh life is supreme

lines.gurmukhi: lK jp qp lK sMjmw hom jg lK vrq krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Jap Tap Lakh Sanjamaan Hom Jag Lakh Varat Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of recitations, disciplines, continences, burnt oblations and fasts are performed.

lines.gurmukhi: lK qIrQ lK aUlKw lK purIAw lK purb lgMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Teerad Lakh Oolakhaa Lakh Pureeaa Lakh Purab Laganday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of holy journeys, charities are undertaken and millions of holy occasions are celebrated.

lines.gurmukhi: dyvI dyvl dyhury lK pujwrI pUj krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Dayvee Dayval Dayhuray Lakh Pujaaree Pooj Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the abodes of goddesses, and the temples, millions of priests perform worship.

lines.gurmukhi: jl Ql mhIAl Brmdy krm Drm lK Pyir iPrMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Jal Dal Maheeal Bharamaday Karam Dharam Lakh Dhayri Dhiranday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Moving on earth and in the sky, millions practitioners of dharma-oriented activities run hither and thither.

lines.gurmukhi: lK prbq vxKMf lK lK audwsI hoie BvMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Parabat Van Khand Lakh Lakh Udaasee Hoi Bhavanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of people becoming unconcerned with worldy affairs go on moving in the mountains and forests.

lines.gurmukhi: AgnI AMgu jlwieNdy lK ihmMcil jwie glMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Aganee Angu Jalaainday Lakh Himanchali Jaai Galaday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions are there who die by burning themselves and millions are there who die by freezing themselves In the snowy mountains.

lines.gurmukhi: guru isKI suKu iqlu n lhMdy ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Soukhu Tilu N Lahanday ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: But they all cannot take even a fraction of joy ,Attainable in the life of a Sikh of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 pUrw gurU nwnk ibn giq nhIN

Shabad OS B.translation: No liberation without the perfect Guru  ''

lines.gurmukhi: cwir vrx kir vriqAw vrnu ichnu ikhu ndir n AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Chaari Varan Kari Varatiaa Varanu Chihanu Kihu Nadari N Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: That Lord is diffused in all the four varnas, but , His own colour and mark are imperceptible.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA drsnu ByKDwrIAwN drsn ivic n drsnu pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Darasanu Bhaykhadhaareeaan Darasan Vichi N Darasanu Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The followers of the six philosophical orders (of India) could not see Him in their philosophies.

lines.gurmukhi: sMinAwsI ds nwv Dir nwau gxwie n nwau iDAwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sanniaasee Das Naav Dhari Naau Ganaai N Naau Dhiaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sannyasis giving ten names to their sects, counted His many names but donnot contemplate the Nam.

lines.gurmukhi: rwvl bwrh pMQ kir gurmuK pMQu n AlKu lKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Raaval Baarah Pand Kari Guramoukh Pandu N Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ravals (yogis) made their twelve sects but the imperceptible way of the gurmukhs could not be known by them.

lines.gurmukhi: bhu rUpI bhu rUpIey rUp n ryK n lyKu imtwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bahu Roopee Bahu Roopeeay Roop N Raykh N Laykhu Mitaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The mimics assumed many forms but even then they could not wipe out the writ (inscribed by the Lord) i.e. they could not attain liberation from transmigration.

lines.gurmukhi: imil imil cldy sMg lK swDU sMig n rMg rMgwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Mili Mili Chaladay Sang Lakh Saadhoo Sangi N Rang Rangaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though millions of people move jointly creating various leagues and sects but they also could not dye their minds in the (steadfast) colour of holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: ivx guru pUry mohy mwieAw ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Vin Guru Pooray Mohay Maaiaa ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: Without the perfect Guru, they all are infatuated by maya.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 ivrly bMdy

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare behave according to the wisdom of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: ikrswxI ikrswx kir Kyq bIij suK Plu n lhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Kirasaani Kirasaan Kari Khayt Beeji Soukh Phalu N Lahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Farmers even having done their farming donot attain the fruit of spiritual Leasure.

lines.gurmukhi: vxju krin vwpwrIey lY lwhw inj Gir n vsMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Vanaju Karani Vaapaareeay Lai Laahaa Nij Ghari N Vasanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The traders engaged in profitable trading donot remain stablized theirselves.

lines.gurmukhi: cwkr kir kir cwkrI haumY mwir n sulh krMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Chaakar Kari Kari Chaakaree Haoumai Maari N Sulah Karanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: The servants go on doing their jobs but not eschewing ego Alley donot meet the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: puMn dwn cMigAweIAwN kir kir krqb iQru n rhMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Pounn Daan Changiaaeeaan Kari Kari Karatab Diru N Rahanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: People, despite their virtues and charities and .even performing many duties donot remain stablized.

lines.gurmukhi: rwjy prjy hoie kY kir kir vwdu n pwir pvMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Raajay Parajay Hoi Kai Kari Kari Vaadu N Paari Pavanday.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming rulers And subjects, people undertake many quarrels but donot go across the world wean.

lines.gurmukhi: gur isK suix guruisK hoie swDsMgiq kir myl imlMdy
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Souni Gurousikh Hoi Saadhasangati Kari Mayl Miladay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikhs of the Guru, adopt teachings of the Guru, and joining the holy congregation attain that supreme Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiq cldy ivrly bMdy ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramati Chaladay Viralay Banday ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only rare ones behave in accordance with the wisdom of the Guru, the Gurmati.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 ibn gux gurU

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru without virtues

lines.gurmukhi: guMgw gwiv n jwxeI bolw suxY n AMdir AwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Goungaa Gaavi N Jaanaee Bolaa Sounai N Andari Aanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The dumb person cannot sing and the deaf cannot hear so that nothing enters their understanding.

lines.gurmukhi: AMnHY idis n AwveI rwiq AnHyrI Gru n is\\\\wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Annhai Disi N Aavaee Raati Anhayree Gharu N Siaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The blind cannot see and in the dark and he cannot identify the house (he lives in).

lines.gurmukhi: cil n skY ipMgulw lUlHw gil imil hyqu n jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Chali N Sakai Pingulaa Loolhaa Gali Mili Haytu N Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A cripple cannot keep pace and a handicapped cannot embrace to show his love.

lines.gurmukhi: sMiF spuqI n QIAY Kusry nwil n rlIAwN mwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Sanddhi Soupoutee N Deeai Khousaray Naali N Raleeaan Maanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A barren woman cannot have a son, nor can she enjoy coition with a eunuch.

lines.gurmukhi: jix jix puqw mweIAwN lwfly nwNv Dryn iD|wxY
lines.transliteration_english: Jani Jani Poutaan Maaeeaan Dalay Naanv Dharayni Dhiaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The mothers giving births to their sons give them pet names lovingly (but mere good names cannot make a good man).

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI siqgurU ivxu sUrju joiq n hoie ttwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikhee Satiguroo Vinu Sooraju Joti N Hoi Tataanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikh life without the true Guru is impossible as a glow worm cannot enlighten the sun.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbdu vKwxY ]21]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadu Vakhaanai ?21?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the holy congretation the word of the Guru is explained (and the jiv cultivates understanding).

lines.gurmukhi: 22 is`KI srb iSromxI hY

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikh life is supreme

lines.gurmukhi: lK iDAwn smwiD lwie gurmuiK rUip n ApiV skY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Dhiaan Samaadhi Laai Guramoukhi Roopi N Aparhi Sakai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of meditational postures and concentrations cannot equal the form of the gurmukh.

lines.gurmukhi: lK igAwn vKwix kir sbd suriq aufwrI QkY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Giaan Vakhaani Kar Sabad Surati Udaaree Dakai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions got tired with learning and elaborations and with flights of consciousness to reach the divine Word.

lines.gurmukhi: buiD bl bcn ibbyk lK Fih Fih pvin iprm dir DkY
lines.transliteration_english: Budhi Bal Bachan Bibayk Lakh Ddhahi Ddhahi Pavani Piram Dari Dhakai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of people using their intellect and powers talk of discerning wisdom but they fall and stagger, and, at the door of the Lord they get jolts and blows.

lines.gurmukhi: jog Bog bYrwg lK sih n skih gux vwsu mhkY
lines.transliteration_english: Jog Bhog Bairaag Lakh Sahi N Sakahi Goun Vaasu Mahakai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of yogis, pleasure seekers and recluses cannot bear the passions and fragrance of the three qualities of nature (sattv, rajas and tamas).

lines.gurmukhi: lK Acrj Acrj hoie Aibgiq giq Aibgiq ivic AkY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Acharaj Acharaj Hoi Abigati Gati Abigati Vichi Akai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of wonderstruck people have got tired of the unmanifest nature of the unmanifest Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: ivsmwdI ivsmwdu lK AkQ kQw ivic shim shkY
lines.transliteration_english: Visamaadee Visamaadu Lakh Akad Kadaa Vichi Sahami Sahakai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions are awe-struck, with the ineffable story of that wondrous Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKI dY AiK PrkY ]22]28]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikhee Dai Akhi Dharakai ?22?28?atdaaee?

Shabad OS B.translation: They all are equal to the delight of one moment of the life of a Sikh of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv gur isK sMD imly sis Gir sUir pUr inj Gir Awey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Gur Sikh Sandh Milay , Sasi Ghari Soori Poor Nij Ghari Aaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: The union of Guru and Sikh leads the Sikh to focus his mind on the divine word. The irha, pingla and Sukhmana enter the tenth door of the Sikh making him realise himself and granting him spiritual peace.

lines.gurmukhi: Elit pvn mn mIn qiRbYnI pRsMg qiRkutI aulMiG suK swgr smwey hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ao?lati Pavan Man Meen Tribainee Prasanga , Trikoutee Ulanghi Soukh Saagar Samaaay Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Practicing Naam Simran, the frolicsome mind becomes peaceful and crossing all hurdles gets engrossed in the realm of peace and tranquillity-the Dasam Duar. They are not to bear the torments of yogic practices.

lines.gurmukhi: qiRgun AqIq cqurQ pd gMimqw kY inJr Apwr Dwr AimA cuAweY hY
lines.transliteration_english: Trigoun Ateet Chaturad Pad Ganmitaa Kai , Nijhar Apaar Dhaar Amia Chuaaeai Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A practitioner of Naam detaches himself from the three pronged influence of mammon i.e. the worldly attractions and reach the stage of absolute.

lines.gurmukhi: ckeI ckor mor cwqiRk AnMdmeI kdlI kml ibml jl Cwey hY ]28]
lines.transliteration_english: Chakaee Chakor Mor Chaatrik Anandamaee , Kadalee Kamal Bimal Jal Chhaaay Hai ?28?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as Chakvi (Sun bird) seeing sun, Chakor (moon bird) seeing moon, rain bird and peacock seeing clouds get into wondrous stage of bliss, similarly a Â·Gunnukh (Guru conscious person) who practices Naam Simran keeps progressing like a lotus flower in the
